page.title: 05CURRENCY IN BALMEDIE
page.content: In the 1980's we have the pound as our unit of currency.There is 100 pennies in a pound.We also have coins,1.00,50p,20p,10p,5p,2p,and a 1p. we used to have a 1/2p but it is now out of date.The notes we have are 500, 100,50,20,10,5 and 1.We have found out some prices and here they are:_Washing powder Â£1.25,trainers Â£7.oo, toothpaste 59p, bike Â£120.00, book Â£1.50, tin of food 54p, BBC Computer Â£340.00, car Â£4000.00, houseÂ£30,000.00 holidayÂ£300.00, those are the prices of some of the things in the 1980s. Things are always getting dearer. These are some of the prices in the 1914s, butter4p per pound, cheese 5p per pound, sugar 1p per pound, fish 2p per pound, tea 7p per pound, coal 6p CWT bag.
